lines.text: [last lines]
There's a bit of a traveler in everybody, Tito. But very few of us know where we're goin'.
We can't go to jail.
Why not?
We're much too young. We can go to a home, though.
We have a home, Tito.
I know, but this is a home where they don't letcha out.
That's a jail.
I don't want to grow up?
Why?
I don't want to get old like O'Sheen.
What?
I don't want to turn into dust.
What's his name?
Um, he's called Tír na nÓg.
What does it mean?
It's the land of eternal youth.
But why's he called that?
He's from Tir na nÓg, the land under the sea.
[first lines]

[to his son]
You're not gonna return there again. You have to pretend your name is Murphy. Do you understand that?
Why are you talkin' to the horse?
Why not?
Are we on the news?
When you through a stone in a lake, it's not happy 'til it hits the bottom. Make sure he doesn't drag us all down with him.

[seeing mother's gravestone]
Why did she die on my birthday?
Oh, me and my stupid stories.

[about the horse]
He's from Tír na nÓg, a land over the sea.
[to the people gathered around the fire]

they saw the most handsome man on Earth get older and older, and greyer and greyer, and his hair grew down to his waist and his fingernails grew three inches long, and his bones began to crumble and snap! And then Oisin disintegrated before their eyes and turned into dust. A little heap of ashes on the ground was all that was left of him.
And how many children do you have?
About fifteen, Sir.

[stuttering]
Aye, about fifteen, Sir. Roughly.
You mean you don't know how many children you have?
Eh... eh... I'd have to count them, Sir.
Children, children! Come here. To the nice man.
[All the children from the neighbourhood are running towards her and the social welfare man]

[Counts the children]
Fourteen. How many boys and how many girls?
I don't count them like that, Sir.
Hands up for the girls.
What did the princess look like?
Close your eyes. Now do you see a beautiful woman?
Yea.
Well, that's her. That's the beautiful princess.

[lifting Ossie down from the horse's back]
Come on. Time for bed.
I don't want to get old.
Ah, you won't get old Ossie. Not yet.

[Ossie and Tito in their flat, sitting on the back of the horse and watching a Western on tv]
Was the old Wild West in Ireland?
There still is. On the other side of the mountains.
Were the travellers the Indians?
No. We're the cowboys.
